title: Stuck geth node on healing state for 4 days
body:
#### System information
Architecture: x86_64
RAM: 16 GB
Memory: 2 TB (gp3)
 
Geth version: ` v1.10.25`
CL client & version: prysmaticlabs/prysm-beacon-chain:v3.1.1
OS & Version: Linux (ubuntu)

#### Expected behaviour
Fully synced geth node and enable subscription service for web3.js by using geth RPC url.

#### Actual behaviour
Heal state in progress for almost 4 days. Subscription method of web3 from RPC url of this node is not working.

#### Geth Execution Command (EL)
````
geth --syncmode snap --ws --ws.addr '0.0.0.0' --ws.origins='*' --ws.port 3334 --ws.api eth,net,web3 --http --http.addr '0.0.0.0' --http.api personal,eth,net,web3,txpool --http.port 9545 --graphql --txlookuplimit=0 --authrpc.addr localhost --authrpc.port 8551 --authrpc.vhosts localhost --authrpc.jwtsecret /path/to/jwt.hex
````

#### Prysm Consensus Command (CL)
````
prysm.sh beacon-chain --execution-endpoint=http://localhost:8551 --datadir /home/ubuntu/prysm/prysm_data --jwt-secret=/path/to/jwt.hex --suggested-fee-recipient=0xaF2**446945b680**1ba23a6*******8A276D
````

#### Geth Logs

````

WARN Syncing deposit contract block cache    est_blocks_remaining: initializing deposits, service: slot_notifier
WARN Execution endpoint is not synced        action: trying fallback, last_seen_block_unix_timestamp: 0, endpoint: http://localhost:8551/, auth=true, service: deposit_contract_rpc
ERRO No synced execution endpoint            advice: ensure you have an execution node configured via --execution-endpoint or if pre-merge, --eth1-endpoints, service: deposit_contract_rpc

````


Geth doesn't get out from healing state since last 4 days. Also I am using geth RPC endpoint for subscription for new block header, which is also not working. How should I make it work.

## State heal

If you are 
- experiencing a very long sync-time, with `State heal in progress` messages for days, 
- and you are using `1.10.xx` 

Then you should switch to `1.11....` We have fixed a lot of state-heal issues on `1.11.,` a.k.a `master`, a.k.a `latest`. You can download this version either via our official [download page](https://geth.ethereum.org/downloads/) or via docker [ethereum/client-go:latest](https://hub.docker.com/r/ethereum/client-go/tags).

> ## State heal > If you are > > * experiencing a very long sync-time, with `State heal in progress` messages for days, > * and you are using `1.10.xx` > > Then you should switch to `1.11....` We have fixed a lot of state-heal issues on `1.11.,` a.k.a `master`, a.k.a `latest`. You can download this version either via our official [download page](https://geth.ethereum.org/downloads/) or via docker [ethereum/client-go:latest](https://hub.docker.com/r/ethereum/client-go/tags). I got it, use `1.11...unstable` version of geth is solve my problem, thanks for you reply.
@holiman Issue resolved after upgrading to `1.10.xx` version.
When will the official 1.11.... version be released? @holiman
